TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WSFederationSerializer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods to convert a WS-Federation message to and objects, which are WS-Trust protocol specific.

MemberSignature.Value: public WSFederationSerializer ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The new instance serializes WS-Federation messages into WS-Trust Feb 2005 protocol messages; an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustFeb2005RequestSerializer> class is used to serialize requests and an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustFeb2005ResponseSerializer> class is used to serialize responses.

MemberSignature.Value: public WSFederationSerializer (System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader) cil managed

Docs.param: An opened on the response XML.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the namespace of the response XML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The request and response messages are serialized based on the namespace of the response XML (the appropriate WS-Trust serializers are used based on the namespace).

MemberSignature.Value: public WSFederationSerializer (System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer requestSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer responseSerializer);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer requestSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer responseSerializer) cil managed

Docs.param: The WS-Trust Serializer to use to read the request (RST).
The WS-Trust Serializer to use to write the response (RSTR).
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified request and response serializers.

Docs.param: The message to convert. This should be an instance of .
Docs.summary: Converts a WS-Federation Sign-In Request message to a object that the security token service (the class) can consume.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the converted Sign-In Request message.
Docs.exception:
The message is not of type .
-or-
The object is missing required information to construct a valid object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override this method to get the wreq string from a reference URL. The default implementation throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
